title: Feeling ‘Paingry’? Managing Stress With AS

content: How do you handle stress? I’m the type of person that buries it deep down and forgets about it. Then when you least expect it, it “pops.” This not only affects me but everyone around me. I know this isn’t the best way to handle stress. I have been working on handling my stress in a more productive way. Here is what I’m trying to help me handle stress.

We have been dealing with some major health issues with our son this last year. There are fewer things more stressful than watching your child hurting, and there is nothing you can do. When I’m stressed, my whole body gets tense, and then the pain comes. This doesn’t do anyone any good. So, when I feel it getting worse, I try to head it off at the pass. If I’m out in public, that may be as simple as finding a quiet place and reading. I have all of my books on my Kindle, so I always have something to read.

content_blocks.text: How do you handle stress? I’m the type of person that buries it deep down and forgets about it. Then when you least expect it, it “pops.” This not only affects me but everyone around me. I know this isn’t the best way to handle stress. I have been working on handling my stress in a more productive way. Here is what I’m trying to help me handle stress.

We have been dealing with some major health issues with our son this last year. There are fewer things more stressful than watching your child hurting, and there is nothing you can do. When I’m stressed, my whole body gets tense, and then the pain comes. This doesn’t do anyone any good. So, when I feel it getting worse, I try to head it off at the pass. If I’m out in public, that may be as simple as finding a quiet place and reading. I have all of my books on my Kindle, so I always have something to read.

content: When I feel stress building at home, I like to head to the garden. My garden is my happy place. I can work at my own pace, and it makes me feel productive. Plus, I started canning my tomatoes and cucumbers! You just need to find something you love to do! I didn’t know gardening was my thing until I tried.

I can get “paingry.” First thing I do when I feel this coming on is tell my wife. I don’t need the added stress of making her mad! Plus, it’s always a good idea to let the people around you know how you are feeling. The next thing I’ll do sounds simple, but it’s not always easy: finding out the reason for the pain. Yes, my feet may hurt, but why? Are my shoes to blame? Have I been on my feet too long without a break? I know this sounds simple, but different pain can cause different kinds of stress.

Yes, my feet may hurt, but why? Are my shoes to blame? Have I been on my feet too long without a break? I know this sounds simple, but different pain can cause different kinds of stress.

content: So maybe pain’s not causing your stress. What then? Sometimes it’s not as simple as physical pain. Talking to someone is always a good idea. It’s never easy for me to start these conversations. I’m not one that likes to talk about myself or my feelings. Burying those feelings never does me any good.

Finding out the root cause for the stress is important. Not all stress is created equal. Some things I can discuss with trusted family and friends, but some things should be left to the professionals. Seeking out a professional is always a good idea.
Stay connected to others with ankylosing spondylitis. Join our Facebook Support Group now.
